title.narrative: OT3.2. SOCIAL NORMS ON INCLUSIVENESS

description.narrative: By 2020, social norms on inclusion of children with disabilities in society are positively changed., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children with disabilities progressively realize their rights to education, rehabilitation and social protection and to participate in community life.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, social norms on inclusion of children with disabilities in society are positively changed.

description.narrative: UNICEF successfully integrated social inclusion messaging in risk communication around COVID-19 and in digital activations, as well as reached parents of children with and without disabilities through publications. Programme communication on children with disabilities and on social inclusion focused on the inclusion of children from Nagorno-Karabakh in Armenia, as well as on the participation of children and young people with disabilities in UNICEF’s UPSHIFT programme to acquire 21stcentury skills. | Status:Met | As-of Date:21/01/2022
